key_points: Super Bowl LV features a quarterback showdown between Patrick Mahomes of the Kansas City Chiefs and Tom Brady of the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
Mahomes and Brady are tied 2-2 in their previous encounters, with each game being closely contested.
Mahomes boasts better cumulative stats in their matchups, with a higher completion percentage and more yards per game than Brady.
Their most recent game was a victory for Mahomes and the Chiefs, where the quarterbacks together amassed over 800 yards.
Brady has appeared in 10 Super Bowls, making this potentially his 10th appearance.
Following the AFC Championship Game victory over the Buffalo Bills, Mahomes praised Brady for speaking highly of him in a past encounter.
Mahomes delivered an impressive performance against the Bills, contributing to the Chiefs' win with 325 yards and three touchdowns.
Key players Travis Kelce and Tyreek Hill had standout performances, with Kelce making crucial catches and Hill amassing 172 receiving yards.
The Chiefs' defense played a significant role in the win, pressuring Bills quarterback Josh Allen and limiting top receiver Stefon Diggs.
The upcoming Super Bowl may be the last time Mahomes and Brady face off, with Brady at 43 years old and Mahomes having a contract through 2031.
